Intervention: Participants received paclitaxel 90 mg/m^2 IV on days 1, 8 and 15 and placebo corresponding to the infusion of bevacizumab IV on days 1 and 15 of a 28-day cycle to progressive disease, treatment limiting toxicity or death.
Participants received paclitaxel 90 mg/m^2 IV on days 1, 8 and 15 and bevacizumab IV 10 mg/kg on days 1 and 15 of a 28-day cycle until progressive disease, treatment limiting toxicity or death.
Eligibility: The HER2-negative adenocarcinoma of the breast, confirmed histologically or cytologically, with locally measurable or non-measurable recidivant or metastatic disease. The local recurrent disease must not be susceptible to resection with curative intent.
For women of childbearing potential, the use of an acceptable and effective method of non-hormonal contraception

For patients who have received recent radiation therapy, pre-randomisation recovery from any significant acute toxicity and radiological treatments should be completed more than 3 weeks after randomization.
• Prior chemotherapy for a local recidivant or metastatic disease
Previous hormonal treatment < 2 weeks prior to randomisation
• Prior adjuvant or neo-adjuvant chemotherapy is permitted, provided that it has been concluded for at least 12 months prior to randomisation.
● Experimental treatment within 28 days of randomization
A serious medical or psychiatric disease that is uncontrolled
• Active infection requiring intravenous antibiotics (IV) during screening
• History of other malignancies within 5 years of screening, with the exception of tumours with a negligible risk of metastasis or death
Results: Percentage of participants who have progressed or died in the population intending to treat (ITT)

The evaluation of tumours was carried out according to the criteria for evaluating the response in version 1.1 of solid tumours (RECIST v1.1) by the investigator. Disease progression was defined as an increase of at least 20 percent (%) in the sum of the diameters of the target lesions compared to the smallest sum of the diameters under study and an absolute increase of at least 5 mm (mm), an unequivocal progression of existing non-target lesions or the presence of new lesions.
Timeline: Basic data, every 8 weeks until disease progression, death or documented clinical limit (up to 117.7 weeks)

The participants received paclitaxel 90 mg/m^2 IV on days 1, 8 and 15 and placebo corresponding to the infusion of bevacizumab IV on days 1 and 15 of a 28-day cycle until disease progression, treatment limiting toxicity or death.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 69.4
The participants received paclitaxel 90 mg/m^2 IV on days 1, 8 and 15 and bevacizumab IV 10 mg/kg on days 1 and 15 of a 28-day cycle until progressive disease, treatment limiting toxicity or death.
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 63.6
